Exaggerate: The claim may be considered an exaggeration because it states that Nigeria has the highest incidence of diabetes in sub-Saharan Africa without providing specific data to support this claim.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient supporting data to back up the statement that Nigeria has the highest incidence of diabetes in sub-Saharan Africa.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Nigeria currently has the highest incidence of diabetes in sub-Saharan Africa based on the statement of a pharmaceutical executive, without considering other potential factors or sources of data.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations or factors that may contribute to the high incidence of diabetes in Nigeria, such as changes in population demographics, lifestyle factors, or healthcare access.
